tags: ....oh boy though. fjord thought he understood caleb but he super didn't did he
i think early fjord especially liked to think the best of people
by his own definition of best which is ''a nice and also cooperative person''
which...really makes sense with his backstory huh (but it's interesting to see how it's changing during this arc!)
also ahhhh i love how this is something that other people might (?) take as an insult but
caleb's just like ''oh thanks i do try''
...actually also he says he has ''math brain'' which is. deeply endearing to me personally
summary: That conversation in episode 41 where Fjord takes Caleb aside and confesses he’s slightly out of his depth with this whole...
body:
That conversation in episode 41 where Fjord takes Caleb aside and confesses he’s slightly out of his depth with this whole Avantika situation is very good both in general and as the distilled essence of these two characters and their dynamic. Because Fjord tells him he’s noticed that Caleb isn’t as “meek” or ”reserved”, as Fjord had initially considered him, but much more calculating and risk-taking than he had expected

And Caleb responds to this with “I’m glad you think so highly of me”

That whole short interaction speaks such volumes about both of their characters

tags: how i feel about most cr pairings is like: i’m just as happy if it’s totally platonic
bc they’re this big found family who trust each other more than they’ve really trusted anyone
summary:
i love how much ashley confirms that yasha completely trusts jester like
jester’s the first friend she thinks of when she’s...
body:
i love how much ashley confirms that yasha completely trusts jester like

jester’s the first friend she thinks of when she’s fighting against the irons, she’s the first person yasha trusts to tell about zuala, she’s there to watch yasha’s fight on the boat in ep 46, yasha trusts her advice on god stuff even though their relationships with their gods are so different, she’s thought jester was adorable since day zero, she lets jester carry her around in zadash

i imagine it also has a little to do with her also being a tiefling, like. yasha has this subconscious trust towards people who remind her of molly, or who molly likes, and they both had to mourn molly knowing they could’ve helped if they were there, they both have that similar, strange sort of trust towards caduceus (i wouldn’t be surprised if every so often, he reminds both of them of molly, like, they’ll see this spark in his eyes and just be taken aback. yasha was there when jester revived caduceus and i imagine her seeing jester’s desperation, the fact that she just had this huge diamond ready and on her, and realizing that jester felt just as guilty about molly’s death as she did, that she’d made this promise to herself that it would never happen again.) having jester is probably a huge part of what’s helped yasha to stay since molly died— even though, being the closest to jester, it would make sense for yasha to be terrified that jester would be the next to leave her, but jester’s too strong and divine and wonderful not to love

it’s not the god squad/gal pal content i was expecting, but i am NOT disappointed

it’s not the god squad/gal pal content i was expecting, but i am NOT disappointed

summary: Can't wait to see what a gleeful Washu Wacco is like when the M9 have good dirt on Bodo the Clown. Kinda also want to know how...
body:
Can’t wait to see what a gleeful Washu Wacco is like when the M9 have good dirt on Bodo the Clown. Kinda also want to know how they came to be each other’s nemesis.

Nevermind about the war between nations and rifts opening from the Abyss, I want to know about why they hate each other so much.

summary: I love the difference between Matt Mercer and Deborah Ann Woll whenever their players make some weird and very specific action...
body:
I love the difference between Matt Mercer and Deborah Ann Woll whenever their players make some weird and very specific action request

Matt’s surprised and slightly amused, “You can certainly try,” and has definitely prepared for their failure versus Deborah’s excited, “It’s cool so I’m gonna allow it! You don’t have to roll you just do that!”

It’s so funny to me

reblog.comment:

summary:
Fuck. Fuck fuck fuck fuck.
The death ray just burst out from the sarcophagus in the Tomb of the Raven Queen's Champion.
Matt...
body:
Fuck. Fuck fuck fuck fuck.

The death ray just burst out from the sarcophagus in the Tomb of the Raven Queen’s Champion.

Matt asked, “Did that drop you below zero?”

I flung my headphones off so fucking fast.

Fuuuck. I’m not ready for this. I’m not ready for this at all.

I’m pretty sure what I think is about to happen is about to happen anyway.

AAAAGGGHHHHH.

I’m so not ready for Vax to give himself up to the Raven Queen.

But I’m never gonna be ready.

I’ve been anticipating this for a while.

"Be not inhospitable to strangers, lest they be angels in disguise."

The writing blog of Sparx. Please feel free to come in, have a cup of tea, and snoop around a little! You might even find something that takes your fancy...

This blog contains 18+ content.

You can find my fics on AO3, and my mixes (both fan and otherwise) at The Old Record Shop (8tracks) and The New Record Shop (spotify).

My main fandom at the moment is Critical Role. Previous fandoms include the Yogscast, Supernatural, Red vs. Blue, and various others, as well as a few pieces of original work - check out the Tags of Interest page for navigation help.

tags: (he doesn't die on-screen tho and he gets better tho don't worry. it's just. not written lol)
and this entire fill is a prime example of 'you can lead a fic writer to water but you can't make them drink'
anyways have some lovely sibling angst :3c
summary: “This is… okay, Beauregard, you know?” wheezes Caleb, softly. There’s blood on his teeth now, turned pink with saliva, and Beau...
body:
“This is… okay, Beauregard, you know?” wheezes Caleb, softly. There’s blood on his teeth now, turned pink with saliva, and Beau can’t stop staring at it. “I am- okay. You need- need to go, go get Jester, take her back to the others. Caduceus- Caduceus can-”

He coughs, chest heaving under her hands, and the red blooms brighter over his teeth and tongue. There’s a hot pulse under her fingers, his blood seeping deeper into the cracks of her knuckles. He whimpers, eyelids fluttering, and she thinks she might be sick.

“There’s fucking nothing about this that is okay, Widogast, you stupid motherfucker,” she hisses, pressing down harder against the bleeding hole in his chest, ignoring the whine of pain it draws out from somewhere deep inside him. She can feel the breath rattling in his lungs, wet and dying. “You- I’m not fucking abandoning you, I-”

There’s a hand around her gore-streaked wrist, the grip surprisingly strong given the amount of blood he’s lost, the lack of colour in his face, the shake in his fingers. “Beauregard,” he murmurs, and his voice is fading, the light in his eyes is fading, the last remnants of colour draining from his cheeks. “Listen- to me. I am dead already. Jester is not.” He smiles, and his lips are red. Beau isn’t crying. She’s not. “I do not need you to hold me as I die.”

“Asshole!” she snaps, loudly, pressing down harder again – and he jerks under her fingers, crying out, eyes rolling in their sockets. Her heart hammers against her ribs like she’s the one with a fatal chest wound, the one bleeding out. “Asshole, you can’t- you can’t fucking die on me, not after- not-”

She remembers Molly, spread-eagle in the snow, blood-slicked from throat to groin with his insides glistening in the weak sun. Her fingers twitch, press against Caleb’s skin like she can hold it together, press the blood back inside him. The crimson on the back of her hands washes away with every drip-drip-drip of saltwater off her nose, replenishes with every fluttering, fading beat of Caleb’s heart.

His fingers twitch around her wrist, slacken a little. “Caduceus has a diamond,” he murmurs, and his eyes are fluttering closed now, the blood is coming slower now, and god, Beau’s not sure her own heart won’t stop beating the same time that his does. “I will… be back, you know. I do not… need you to… hold…”

“Fuck you, Caleb,” she whispers, unsteady, her hands awash with scarlet as she leans down to press a kiss to his forehead. He’s cold, so cold, still other than the fading tremors, and his eyes track her sluggishly, pupils barely visible in the crescents his eyes have become. She can’t feel his heartbeat beneath her fingers any more, though the blood is still pooling around them. “I’m here. I’m here. I’m not going ‘til you do, okay? I’m not going anywhere. I‘m here. I’m here.”

reblog.comment:
“This is… okay, Beauregard, you know?” wheezes Caleb, softly. There’s blood on his teeth now, turned pink with saliva, and Beau can’t stop staring at it. “I am- okay. You need- need to go, go get Jester, take her back to the others. Caduceus- Caduceus can-”

He coughs, chest heaving under her hands, and the red blooms brighter over his teeth and tongue. There’s a hot pulse under her fingers, his blood seeping deeper into the cracks of her knuckles. He whimpers, eyelids fluttering, and she thinks she might be sick.

“There’s fucking nothing about this that is okay, Widogast, you stupid motherfucker,” she hisses, pressing down harder against the bleeding hole in his chest, ignoring the whine of pain it draws out from somewhere deep inside him. She can feel the breath rattling in his lungs, wet and dying. “You- I’m not fucking abandoning you, I-”
